issue.title: Splitwise App
issue.body:
## Build expense-sharing app

**Features:**
- Google OAuth login
- Create groups, add expenses
- Split equally, view balances

**Tech:** Next.js 14, Tailwind, shadcn/ui, SQLite, NextAuth.js

**Pages:** Landing, Login, Dashboard, Group detail

ems.task: Create project foundation with Next.js 14 setup, including package.json with all dependencies (NextAuth, Google OAuth provider, better-sqlite3, shadcn/ui, Tailwind), tsconfig.json with strict mode, .gitignore for Next.js, and initialize basic project structure (app/ directory, components/, lib/, prisma/ for SQLite schema).
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Implement authentication system and database layer. Create NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth provider, design and implement SQLite database schema for users, groups, expenses, and balances using Prisma ORM. Build all database models, migrations, and seed data. Owns: lib/auth.ts, lib/prisma.ts, prisma/schema.prisma, app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts.

workers.task: Set up Prisma ORM with SQLite database. Create prisma/schema.prisma with User, Group, Expense, ExpenseSplit, and Balance models. Generate Prisma client and create lib/prisma.ts singleton instance. Run initial migration and create seed data in prisma/seed.ts.

Configure NextAuth.js with Google OAuth provider. Create lib/auth.ts with NextAuth configuration, session management, and user callbacks. Set up app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts API handler. Configure environment variables for Google OAuth credentials.

Create database utility functions and type-safe Prisma helpers. Implement lib/db/users.ts for user CRUD operations, lib/db/groups.ts for group management, and lib/db/expenses.ts for expense operations. Ensure all functions use the Prisma singleton from lib/prisma.ts.

ems.task: Build core application logic and API routes. Implement group creation/management, expense creation with equal splitting logic, balance calculation algorithms, and all CRUD operations. Create RESTful API endpoints for groups and expenses. Owns: app/api/groups/, app/api/expenses/, lib/calculations.ts, lib/actions.ts for server actions.

workers.task: Create database models and SQLite schema setup. Implement Group and Expense models with all CRUD database operations. Set up SQLite connection and initialize database tables.

Implement balance calculation algorithms and expense splitting logic. Create functions to calculate equal splits, compute balances between users, and determine who owes whom. Include utility functions for financial calculations.

Create RESTful API routes for groups and expenses. Implement all endpoints for group management (create, read, update, delete, add members) and expense operations (create, list, update, delete). Handle request validation and authentication checks.

ems.task: Create all UI components and pages. Build landing page, login/logout flow, dashboard with group overview, group detail pages with expense lists and balance views. Integrate shadcn/ui components (Button, Card, Input, Dialog, etc.) with Tailwind styling. Owns: app/page.tsx, app/login/page.tsx, app/dashboard/page.tsx, app/group/[id]/page.tsx, components/ui/, components/expense-form.tsx, components/balance-card.tsx.

workers.task: Create core UI components using shadcn/ui - Button, Card, Input, Label, Dialog components with Tailwind styling. Set up components/ui/ directory structure and base component implementations.
Build public-facing pages - landing page (app/page.tsx) and login page (app/login/page.tsx) with Google OAuth integration. Implement authentication UI flow.

Build authenticated application pages - dashboard (app/dashboard/page.tsx) with group overview, and group detail page (app/group/[id]/page.tsx) with expense list. Create domain-specific components: ExpenseForm and BalanceCard.

analysisSummary: Build a complete expense-sharing application with Google OAuth authentication, group management, expense tracking, and balance calculations. Tech stack: Next.js 14, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui components, SQLite database, and NextAuth.js.
